page.title: 08Traffic around Brookmans Pk
page.content: No main roads go through Brookmans Park and many of the roads in the village are private and are repaired by the people who live there. The main road which goes by the village is the A1000 which is called the Great North Road. Up to about 20 years ago this was the main road to the north of England and we have found mention of it several hundred years ago when it was a turnpike or toll road. The A1000 is used to reach the new M25 and the A1(M) so it is quite busy. There are often accidents on it near the village and only two weeks ago (beginning of July 1985) there was a serious accident when a car was speeding along the A1000 and hit a car coming out from a side road. Local people have been asking for a speed limit but so far this has been refused.
